reviewText: My confusion began with watching the trailer. I watched it three times in a row and still didn't understand, but became obsessed. I had to know.\n\nEven after playing for a little while now, I'm 100% baffled by this game. Its strangely beautiful, the controls make very little sense, the bullets do really weird things. It's a glorious trainwreck and I'm happy it exists.

reviewText: Have you ever wanted to fly around in the astral plane shooting out triangles from your head in a random direction at medusa statues, spectral bears, and giant sword wielding demons or space dragon boss monsters?\n\nWell now you can. Collect crystal d20's to increase the yellow something meter so you get more triangles or something. And press combinations of V B N Space keys to shoot things out in weird directions while moving with the arrow keys around rippling space backgrounds.

reviewText:
Product received for free

The Renegades of Orion 2.0 is perhaps one of the most creative and yet terrible single screen shoot'em ups out there. Most shmups have you as a space vessel, but you are some piece of 80s rock metal album cover artwork sprang to life. I would have preferred a more traditional route, but if you're going to be weird, go so far over the top that you end up in space.

Your goal is to destroy bosses, but the real challenge to the game are terrible controls, poor design choices and giant hit boxes. The arrow keys control move you around in 8 directions, but you are so slow and sluggish. Enemies can move in a full 360 degrees and just aim at you. Under normal circumstances, this is never an issue, but you and the enemies are each so large that its tough to maneuver to avoid them.

The only real attack here is eye lasers that halt you so there's a fight or flight thing going on, but never both at once. You need to get to a corner of the screen, shoot then move as enemies pile on you. When you move there is a chance that your eye lasers will move with you like if you move north, the lasers will move north.

There are other attacks, but the seem cumbersome and complicated. They require two keys and your attack key to work and even then your eye lasers shoot at the nearest small enemy, so there's never a reason to use anything else. Think of that as the game's balance. When you're being rushed head on, your attack does the same thing. If you go to the top of the screen where your head is above the screen and then shoot, nothing happens. The eye lasers are made up of tiny weak projectiles that launch every frame.

The keybinds are bizare. H for save, G for load. F for fullscreen I can understand in a way. The rest is just spacebar and shift.... to pause! When I press F12 to take a screenshot in Steam, a chrome extension for developer tools pops up. That's an interesting feature. I was never expecting that.

The game starts with you one on one facing a boss who summons demons to hover at you. Even from the first moments of gameplay there are issues. At the end of the boss there is a glitch that seems to fire off the same sound effect each frame. Most developers would have the sound once, but whatever.I also took note that at the bottom of the screen you have a giant health meter at the bottom and the boss health meter is a small number in the right corner.

I would say this is someone's first game, but I can also say its trying to be terrible on purpose. Its amazing this game can be 2.0, because as it stands now its cumbersome, tough and over complicated. The Renegades of Orion 2.0 is a valuable way to learn game design at its smallest levels. You have a simple game here and yet everything goes wrong with it.

Perhaps the biggest sin of Renegades is that its just dull and uninspiring. You can laugh at how bad the game is, but beyond that, there's no reason to push on.

On top of the bare bones content of just play" there is paid downloadable content. There's just not that much of a game here. Its more of an oddity than something that could be confused for entertainment or fun. I was done after a minute of playing
recommended: I had to push on.\n\nThe game can be salvaged with some sort of score system to make it more of an arcade game. As a single screen shooter
hoursPlayed: there just needs to be something that's more engaging that lets me feel like I'm in control rather than fighting a tough game.\n\nThank you to my friend Blanka for giving me Renegades of Orion 2.0. Hey even if I dislike it
voteText: I still thank you for it."

reviewText:
During the recent years, there has been an influx of indie games like never before, and its rare to find something that you can just jump into and don't have to remember where you left off.
Pros:
- Its a fun game which anyone can play at anytime, and on any PC as its not demanding at all.
- Reminds you of old school dungeon games a bit, and for the older audience of steam (like me), it will bring back a lot of memories.
- Doesn't looks half bad and you can really loose yourself in it.

Would have been MUCH more fun with a co-op option, as doing anything with a friend is enjoyable, and this is the kind of game usually does it.

Cons:
- Controls though, are NOT easy to remember. Takes a good lil while to get used to them.

This is not the kind of game you put a lot of thought into buying, so i'm going to keep this short.
Buy it, its nothing complicated or immersive, but its just a plain old fun time. Play this to take a break from your usual AAA titles. Well worth the very moderate price tag.

reviewText:
Hello folks,

This is a nice, interesting and entertainment game filled with lot of fantasy of flashing colours, unsuspected enemies, unique  and many other things that will grant you fun with your open eyes all time. This is about arcade universal space shooter 2d in a world intergalactic and where you need collect some usefull crystals to gain powers or such to beat some enemies and bosses around. These enemies are spawn and come harassing at you from all directions very frecuently randomly to keep you in the offensive mode while you keep fighting your way towards the boss monsters.

Basically shoot everything that comes to you and stay moving in the air dodging enemy fire which is the key preventing they take your powers or your life.


My experience while I was playing was quite facinated and pleased that took my attention with the abstract art show, the crazies stylized projectiles. Wierd thing is even after having played the game stays in my mind which is so fun though. It remind me to some arcade game I played in the past that can't remember now but this one was by far much better due his creativity of colorful orbs of light,etc . Grateful of who made this cool galactic game. Rated 10/10.

reviewText:
I received a  key for this from dev .

I'm not one for writing long reviews ,i'll leave that to more qualified reviewers.

I love the games art work  and commend the dev for trying to do something different.
The game reminds me of one of those schmup type games but instead of a spaceship you have a humanoid type character who looks very similar to Silversurfer .

Tap the 'space' key to start the game at the loading screen ,you are immediately thrown into a difficult battle with a boss and more enemies that appear around you .

Comtrols seem to work well on keyboard ,i found it a bit too difficult but i think that's because i don't play alot of these types of games :) .


Someone more experienced might enjoy the challenge and it's priced very cheap .

p,s:
Watch the screen near the start as it tells you what keys you need to use ,plus you can combine keys to do different attacks

edit:
I just killed the first boss ,so i think it just takes a bit of practce ,it's a lot easier once you
become  accustomed to the gameplay and if you're not rubbish like me :) .

+1 for the artwork .
